contextId.information: AT: "the person who seeks him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
These two phrases share similar meanings and are combined for emphasis. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
contextId.quote: their insults, all their plots against me

contextId.information: Yahweh was very angry, and he has done everything he wanted to do to show that he was angry. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
contextId.quote: Yahweh showed all his wrath; he poured out his fierce anger

contextId.information: These two lines share similar meanings and emphasize that these spiritual leaders were largely responsible for the fall of Jerusalem. AT: "the terrible sins of her prophets and priests" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
contextId.quote: the sins of her prophets and the iniquities of her priests

contextId.information: AT: "All the women, young and old, are raped in Jerusalem and in the cities of Judah" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
contextId.quote: Women are raped in Zion ... virgins in the cities of Judah
